quest.name: Tremble Finishing
journal:
 Quest Sync
Mogek waves his little paws excitedly.

After discovering that the roar of dragons can strengthen the aspect of crystals in the vicinity, Mogek wonders whether the roar will have the same effect on kupa trees, strengthening the crystals growing within their massive trunks. He asks you to call upon Whei Ahf to test the theory, while also taking advantage of the opportunity to have him roar to strengthen a crystal cluster.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

With a flip and a flick of the tail, the dextrous dragonet calls for Whei Ahf, whom you bestride and guide to the kupa tree.

※Speak with the dextrous dragonet in Bahrr Lehs to mount Whei Ahf.
Whei Ahf roars upon the crystal, which begins to strongly gleam. The moogle nearby observes the growth excitedly as you take off to find the crystal cluster.
Whei Ahf brings his magicks to bear on the crystal cluster, which shines brighter in response. Return to Mogek and report what you have seen.

While it is too early to tell whether the results of Whei Ahf's roar on the kupa tree have been fruitful, Mogek is relieved that there appear to be no negative outcomes from the experiment. He expresses appreciation to you and Whei Ahf for your efforts.
objectives: Ride Whei Ahf and use his Roar ability on the kupa tree.
Ride Whei Ahf and use his Roar ability on the crystal cluster.

dialogue.name: MOGEK
dialogue.text: Forename, the Mogmenders and I had a splendid idea! Do you recall how crystals are strengthened when bathed in the roar of dragons?

dialogue.name: MOGEK
dialogue.text: Well, consider the kupa tree, rich in aether and a natural source of crystals. If Whei Ahf were to roar at one, surely it would bear even better crystals, yes?

dialogue.name: MOGEK
dialogue.text: We would like to test this theory, so could you summon Whei Ahf and ask him to roar upon a kupa tree? Oh, and while you're at it, might you also stop by one of the clusters we gather and have him roar on it as well?

dialogue.name: WYVERNRECEPTION02319
dialogue.text: Well met, daughterson of man. What is your business here?

dialogue.name: WYVERNRECEPTION02319
dialogue.text: And so you are requesting the help of Whei Ahf once more. Give me a moment, I shall call him over.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crystals within the kupa tree trunk softly glow with aetheric energy. Return with Whei Ahf and use his Roar ability to nurture its growth.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The enormous crystal cluster softly glows with aetheric energy. Return with Whei Ahf and use his Roar ability to nurture its growth.

dialogue.name: NEARMOOGLEA02319
dialogue.text: Right here, right here! We need Whei Ahf to stand right here and roar, kupo!

dialogue.name: NEARMOOGLEB02319
dialogue.text: Oooh, this crystal is sooo big, kupo...

dialogue.name: WYVERNRECEPTION02319
dialogue.text: Oh, where can he be? Please wait here for a moment.

dialogue.name: NEARMOOGLEA02319
dialogue.text: Look how it glows! Surely the crystals are stronger now, kupo!

dialogue.name: WYVERN02319
dialogue.text: (-Whei Ahf-)There was one more that you would have me bellow my magicks upon, yes?

dialogue.name: NEARMOOGLEA02319
dialogue.text: I'm eager to see what happens, but I fear it is like waiting for a flower to bloom...

dialogue.name: NEARMOOGLEB02319
dialogue.text: The aether in the cluster is changing, I can feel it! I'll have to be careful not to get sick...

dialogue.name: WYVERN02319
dialogue.text: (-Whei Ahf-)And with that, it would seem my work here is done. I am glad to have been of some help to you, daughterson of man. Now let us return.

dialogue.name: NEARMOOGLEB02319
dialogue.text: I'm already starting to feel a little woozy, kupo. Maybe I should...move back a bit.

dialogue.name: MOGEK
dialogue.text: You're back, kupo! I'm glad that I didn't see any explosions in the distance. I was a little worried that the magicks of dragons might be too potent in the presence of all that aether.

dialogue.name: MOGEK
dialogue.text: It makes me reflect on how fortunate we are to have you and Whei Ahf assist us like this. If it weren't for you two, I don't think the Mogmenders would have made it half as far as they have.

dialogue.name: MOGEK
dialogue.text: I suppose it just goes to show that no moogle is an island, kupo!
